text: - My name is Ming Ming Lei,

and I'm a software
development manager at AWS.
I've used AWS as an external customer,

and I was just always kind
of curious how it works.
I love the scale of everything that we do.
Coming from the outside,

it seems like this very
cohesive organization,

but the truth is there's a
lot of freedom internally

to make the choices
that you think are right
for your service.

And at some point, someone
may come and tell you
that you need to kind of pivot,
but that kind of comes later on.
The people who do really well at AWS,

especially in the software
role they kind of have to learn

to embrace the chaos and
that's kind of the big question
that I ask people.
Are you scared to take risks?

And if you are kind of
scared to take risks,

I kind of recognize that
AWS may not be an ideal fit.
(cheerful music)
